node.title: Two global superpowers, one Zoom call and four hours: Did the Biden-Xi summit avert catastrophe?
node.alt: A composite shot of Chinese President Xi Jinping and US President Joe Biden
node.description: Tensions between the US and China are simmering. But one of the few areas Joe Biden and Xi Jinping agree on is that letting relations deteriorate further would be a mistake of historic proportions, writes Kathryn Diss.
node.content:
["In the West Wing of the White House, President Joe Biden sat with his hands clasped\u00a0at the head of the table.", "Two television screens, propped up on temporary stands, beamed a live feed of his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping to the room \u2014\u00a0and the globe \u2014 from the Great Hall of the People in Beijing.", "Despite being almost two years into the new world of coronavirus-induced global diplomacy, it still feels understated and somewhat odd that a meeting of such high consequence\u00a0would take place this way.\u00a0", "All the usual pleasantries\u00a0of deep-rooted relationships and ongoing ties were exchanged, but there was a great deal for these two global superpowers to discuss and not much of it is particularly pleasant.", "The call, which was initiated at Mr Biden's request, reflects his administration's deep concern that the chances of keeping conflict at bay with Beijing might be diminishing.", "The virtual summit, which comes at a time of heightened tensions between the two nations, is the third time Mr Biden has spoken to Mr Xi\u00a0since assuming office.\u00a0", "It's the first time this year they have spoken face to face, albeit via video hook-up.\u00a0", "
The simmering tensions between the US and China
", "In true American fashion, Mr Biden cut to the chase quickly\u00a0and the parameters of the meeting were set.\u00a0", "Mr Biden told Mr Xi that\u00a0to ensure the two countries don't veer into conflict: \"We need to establish some common-sense guardrails\".\u00a0", "", "
Tensions between the two leaders have been high recently amid disagreements over Hong Kong, Taiwan and lingering trade disputes.\u00a0(Reuters: David McNew)
", "Although more subtle, with messages hidden between the lines, Mr Xi struck a similarly conciliatory tone, extending the pleasantries to call Mr Biden \"my old friend\".\u00a0", "Without question, the pair had much to discuss.\u00a0", "The past few months of relations between the world's two largest economies have resounded with echoes of Cold War-like behaviour.\u00a0", "In a show of military muscle, Beijing last month flew a record-breaking number of planes into airspace near Taiwan, just to prove it could ultimately use force to take control of the island.\u00a0", "The United States announced it would provide nuclear submarine technology to Australia, with the prospect its subs could pop up, undetected, along the Chinese coast.", "", "
Joe Biden, Boris Johnson, Scott Morrison made the surprise alliance announcement in September.(AP: Evan Vucci)
", "Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison described\u00a0the need to go nuclear, driven by the threat China posed in the Indo-Pacific.\u00a0", "So, when Mr\u00a0Biden called for a summit with Mr Xi, it undoubtedly garnered the attention of domestic and world media.\u00a0", "
The biggest issue of all is one small island
", "Much of what was discussed in the three-hour summit will remain behind closed doors.", "But the fact this meeting has happened at all between the world's two most powerful leaders tells you they're hoping to dial down tensions.", "Taiwan was front and centre for both global powers, just for different reasons.", "Beijing wants Washington to butt out from what it classifies as domestic affairs.", "Mr Biden\u00a0has already publicly stated the US will defend Taiwan if attacked by China, departing from a long-held foreign policy position of \"strategic ambiguity\", which kept Washington's stance vague.", "", "
The biggest point of contention between the US and China is Taiwan.\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Pichi Chuang)
", "Before the White House could get organised to brief Washington reporters after the marathon talks, Chinese state media got the jump and started leaking statements from Mr\u00a0Xi's talking points.", "
Was anything achieved?\u00a0
", "While the meeting was all about repairing ties, Mr Xi shot warning signals across the bow, describing the two countries as \"two ships that should not collide\".", "He also added that\u00a0China would have to take decisive measures if \"Taiwan independence forces cross the red line\".\u00a0", "Senior administration officials in Washington briefing reporters said the two leaders discussed Taiwan at length.\u00a0", "But nothing new was agreed.\u00a0", "Instead, Mr Biden reasserted US support of the One China Policy, which recognises only one Chinese government.", "It could be seen as yet another concession to Beijing.\u00a0", "Without seeing the two leaders interact in person, it's difficult to draw conclusions on how it went from body language.", "There was no major breakthrough on relations nor agreements to ease tensions.\u00a0", "But one of the few areas the two leaders agree on\u00a0is that\u00a0letting relations deteriorate further would be a mistake of historic proportions.\u00a0"]
